security: This document contains internal personnel information, including the position title and office assignment of an individual considered for an award. Disclosing such information could violate privacy regulations and reveal internal agency structures. Specifically, the document includes: 'NAME: (Last) (First) (Middle) POSITION TITLE citor Actg.D.p. Chtos/c/o PRESENT GRADE OFFICE ASSIGNED TO STATION curity Ladieuarters'.
summary: A report from the Honor Awards Board concerning a recommendation for an award, ultimately disapproving the award of a Certificate of Merit with Distinction but not recommending an alternative award.
summary_one_paragraph: This report, dated 2 March 1959, documents the Honor Awards Board's review of a recommendation to award a Certificate of Merit with Distinction to an individual with the position title 'citor Actg.D.p. Chtos/c/o' and assigned to 'curity Ladieuarters'. The board disapproved the recommendation, concluding that while the service performed was valuable, it wasn't outstanding enough to merit an honor award. The report is signed by Gordon L. Herwit, Chairman of the Honor Awards Board, and Ford Poulton, Director of Central Intelligence.
title: Report of Honor Awards Board
